posts.raw_content:
If you haven't seen this, and you still think "homeless" people are just normal people who fell on hard times and just can't afford a place to live, I invite you to watch this documentary from 6 years ago. It is completely in line with my experience  meeting homeless people when I traveled across the country back in 2009. 

99.999% of these people are simply drug addicts and severely mentally ill people or both. Calling them "homeless" is simply a way to ignore what's really going on. Yes, we have a poster on here who says he was once homeless and he wasn't a drug addict, and that's great, but he is CLEARLY the rare exception and not the rule. Do a little research and you'll see the literally every city in America has programs for the "homeless" that provides housing and support, but they don't make use of it. Why? Because that's not where they can score their drugs, plain and simple They live in the tent cities because that's where the drugs are. The kindest thing we can do for these people is put them in rehab (or a loony bin) and if they refuse, put them in jail until they beg for mercy and agree to rehab. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bpAi70WWBlw
posts.author: weholdthesetruths
posts.title: If Trump is really giving the "homeless" in DC a choice between drug treatment or jail, then he's handling it the right way. See "Seattle is Dying" investigative report from 6 years ago here
